turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Hello Pat!

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Hi Liz! What can I do for you?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I’m kind of in a rush on my way to the office. I have a Starbucks craving. Can you order ahead for me?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Sure! Which location do you want to stop into?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I’m close to 43rd Street and Broadway in Manhattan right now, so you can place the order there.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Okay, what would you like?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I really like the cherry mocha latte.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Sounds good!

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Yes! I just love that latte!

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: How do you want it prepared?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I want it in a grande size, and instead of milk, I want soy milk.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Okay!

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Hold on Pat. On second thought, let me get a venti size.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Okay, venti size.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Actually, can you order something else for me?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Sure! What would you like?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I have a craving for the bacon, Gouda and egg breakfast sandwich. I’d like to order that with the cherry mocha.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Okay! I’ll make sure to order that for you. What time will you be at the location.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I’ll be there in 15 minutes. Use my usual Starbucks account to order it.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Okay, I’m placing the order and the receipt will be texted to your cell.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Thanks so much Pat! You’re a great help.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Glad to do it! Enjoy!
